Revokes [[operator]] status from a [[player]].

==Syntax==

* '''Java Edition'''
:<code>deop <targets></code>

* '''Bedrock Edition'''
:<code>deop <player: target></code>

== Arguments ==
{{argument|targets|game_profile|player: target|CommandSelector<Player>}}
: Specifies the player to be deopped.
: {{IN|java}}, {{lcfirst:{{arg desc|je=game_profile}}}}
: {{IN|bedrock}}, {{lcfirst:{{arg desc|be=player|type=players}}}}

==Result==

{{Result table}}
{{Result table|The command is incomplete, or any argument is not specified correctly.|unparseable|unparseable}}
{{Result table|<code><targets></code> fails to resolve to one or more player profiles.|fail|N/A}}
{{Result table|<code>player: target</code> is a target selector that is not in [[Target_selectors#Player_type_and_single_type|player type]].|N/A|fail}}
{{Result table|<code>player: target</code> fails to resolve to one or more online players.}}
{{Result table|All selected players meet one or both of the following conditions:
* Not an op.
* Has [[permission level]] of 4 or higher.{{only|bedrock}}|fail}}
{{Result table|succeed}}
{{Result table}}

== Output ==

{{Output table}}
{{Output table|edition=je|On fail|N/A|0|0}}
{{Output table|On success|N/A|1|the number of players whose op status is revoke}}
{{Output table}}

==Examples==

* To remove Steve from the list of operators: <code>deop Steve</code>

== See also ==
* {{cmd|op}} — gives [[operator]] status to a player.
